website_summaries.verdict: A popular, easy-to-use dehydrator with an effective method for drying food.
pros: Stands up to its name by offering fast drying times
Includes 4 trays and can be expanded to as many as 12
cons: Food occasionally falls through small gaps in the trays
Occasional reports of units that quit working unexpectedly

customer_reviews.title: Motor stop working ? Here is the solution:
customer_reviews.text: There is a thermal fuse which seems to blow in these things very easily. I located the part that is needed on Amazon. It is here
customer_reviews.author: Kevino

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a 20 year old version of the same dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: After 20 years, my old one finally burned up, so I bought the same model so I can still use all of my old trays. Great little machine. The new trays are even better. On my old one, the jerky tends to stick a little. On these new trays, they don't stick at all.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product and Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return the product upon unboxing. It was very obvious that the trays did not stack aligned. There was a gap (warped) that would not seal and if I were to use the product the air would simply escape. I have owned many dehydrators in the past but they always lasted and at least started out in good condition. I’m really disappointed as I was hoping that I wouldn’t have to spend $100+ dollars on the shelf type of dehydrator. In summary, I am disappointed with the quality of the product that was made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Murshed

customer_reviews.title: NESCO American Harvest Snackmaster Food Dehydrator Model FD-60
customer_reviews.text: This unit met my expectations. I use it to dry fruit and veggies. I previously owned a NESCO FD-61 Snackmasster food dehydrator. I called customer service and asked what the difference was between the two models. I was told that in features and performance there was no difference. Since purchasing this new unit I have used it several time with 4 additional trays to allow for an 8 tray capacity. It dehydrates just as expected and without needing to rotate the trays until I add more than 8 trays total. I would recommend this unit for small capacity, home use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: Followed all directions perfectly. Never turned on. Ruined a week's worth of barley prep and my son is PO'd...he worked so hard...all for nothing. The plastic is cheap. The trays have HUGE holes so his barley will fall thru as it dries anyway (if it ever stood a chance of drying since the dumb machine does not even turn on). Will not buy another Nesco product. Returning this POC. Thanks Nesco.
customer_reviews.author: Maryanne

customer_reviews.title: Work too well!
customer_reviews.text: Always love these. This is my 4th one. All of them still work but my friends borrow them and never bring them back. They just give me money to buy another one to replace the one they kept from me!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Crump

customer_reviews.title: dried bananas evenly
customer_reviews.text: received Nesco FD-60 3 weeks ago. experimented with 1 tray of plantains and things went well. Just finished 3 1/2 trays of plantains in 4 hours were all dried evenly with less than 20% (probably thicker)needed an additional 30 minutes. No tray rotation was needed. I purchased this unit after using Nutrichef PKFD 12 (hot air source from bottom)for 2 years and being dissatisfied because of significant drying variation from top to bottom tray (necessitating frequent vertical repositioning) and drying outer fruit much quicker than central fruit. Looking forward to mango season.
customer_reviews.author: oldguy

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd one. I loved the first.
customer_reviews.text: I had one for a long time and dehydrated a ton of food over that time. It died and I ordered a new one. I found the receipt for the old one and it was over 7 years old and like I said, it has served me very well. Now that I bought a new one, I can use the old trays and the fruit roll up sheet with the new one. So now I have doubled my drying capacity. I really do like this machine and how fast it works.
customer_reviews.author: Growerht5

customer_reviews.title: Works great, a dandy kitchen item to have.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, I still use the first one and bought the second one, when making batches of jerky. The dehydrator full will completely dry the jerky, in 7-8 hours, and makes a gallon freezer bag full of jerky. During the summer we also use it to dry large quantities of vegetable that are extra in the garden, and use them for soups and stews during the winter months. Cleanup is a breeze, as all the trays are under the heat/fan unit, and just pop them in the dishwasher when done using them. I have been using the first one for 8 years now, with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Koger

customer_reviews.title: Trays don't line up and it's very frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: The machine works good for the price.... However the frustration with trying to get the trays to line up is overwhelming. My husband even came out to help me and walked away. I'm returning it and purchasing one that is more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Rindy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This thing died in the middle of making jerky, after about 10 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every week during the summer months to dehydrate hot peppers for my hot spicy mix. I have used it for apples, bananas, and jerky. It works great. Just updating my review after a few more years of use. The dehydrator is still going strong. I use the my old Snack Master trays and stack them up pretty high (12 trays), and it does just fine. I use it a lot, and if if died today, I feel that I got my money's worth and replace it with the same type.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Miss

customer_reviews.title: Motor got burned
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned it with paper towels, cut all my apples and set them into the trays only to find out it didn’t work. It smelled like something was burning and then I saw smoke coming out from the top lid/ motor. I unplugged it and checked to see if it was my outlet (everything else worked but the dehydrator).
customer_reviews.author: bslpbu

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't appear to be a new item
customer_reviews.text: Despite ordering a new product, this item looks used. Box was worn, Item not as clean as I would expect a new item and doesn't appear to have all internal packaging. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dehydrator.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dehydrator. I originally had another nesco, a cheaper model, that I was not too thrilled with. The other one had no temperature settings, and it ran loud and hot. This one is quiet and has adjustable settings so it doesnt get too hot. Also, the trays of this one are of better sturdier quality. The other one I had warped a tray after a few hours of use. This one I've left on overnight and everything was perfect. Only thing I liked better about the other one was that it was clear, and I could see the progress.... but it isnt too much work to open the lid and take a peek.
customer_reviews.author: eg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic over & over again.
customer_reviews.text: Does just fine! I thought about buying a much more expensive one for quite some time, but then finally just got this one because I had borrowed two of them from a friend before and they did just fine. I am making jerky treats for the dog with it right now. When I borrowed two of these, I used them non-stop for about 4 months and they never failed to perform. I was making dehydrated meals for the Appalachian Trail. That was A LOT of dehydrating. This little machine did the job great!! I don't see any point to spending hundreds on a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nesco FD-60 Snackmaster Express
customer_reviews.text: I owned this for about 8 years and the motor stopped. I thought about it for a few weeks before deciding to buy another one. Now I have 8 trays to dry spinach and other items for smoothies. This allows me to always have fruits and veggies without worrying about them going bad if I don't use them quickly enough. I always have a Mason jar full of spinach powder available and now I prefer the dried to the fresh.
customer_reviews.author: SteaksMom

customer_reviews.title: Does not have on off switch
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it made fruit snacks. I did not like the fact that there is no on and off switch and you must pull the plug to stop the electricity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with my original 15 year old Snackmaster -- works great
customer_reviews.text: Drys everything very well. I dry food for self support river trips in packrrafts. I love it. Meat, fruit, veggies -- it does it all.
customer_reviews.author: stony2275

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased! Mostly.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little food dehydrator. Makes the best banana chips ever. Just wish there was a completely stainless steel version with aluminum fan blades and non-plastic motor. Polypropylene is acceptable for a short time (because I'm not completely consumed by my fear of plastics yet), but I'm considering using this design as a basis to construct my own metal version since even the stainless manufacturers have plastic motors and fans. Part of my purpose would be to prevent off-gassing VOCs in my apartment due to the 165 degree heat. Hot plastics are bad, mmmmmay...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Replace broken dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: My old American Harvester dehydrator broke down, so I needed a replacement. Instead of the trays setting on top of the bottom containing the motor, the motor top sits over the trays. This makes it much cleaner without having food fall into the blower. This doesn't have a timer, but I found the timer an unnecessary option. It works just as well as the original American Harvester dehydrator and uses the same trays. I've dried pasta sauce, thick soups, fruit, backpacking dinners, bananas, raspberries, ground beef, and made a batch of salty jerky from the packets that came with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Frank X. Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Not a great experience
customer_reviews.text: Very excited about using new dehydrator. Plugged it in and nothing. Called Amazon and they sent replacement. Plugged it in and ran for one minute with very strong electrical smell and then nothing. I bought this particular brand and model because of the good ratings. Maybe it just wasn’t my day.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Motor died, twice
customer_reviews.text: These don't last that long - about two years, and then the motors die. I've had it happen twice, so far... not sure I'll get this model or brand now that I need another one. I still gave it three stars because until the motor kicks the bucket, it works fine. But plan on replacing it frequently!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schuneman

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fast & quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Saturday and did my first batch of dehydrated bananas on Sunday. Wow, very fast compared to the old one I had and quiet. Great product and they tasted great.
customer_reviews.author: BMW

customer_reviews.title: Great food dryer
customer_reviews.text: Got this Nesco dehydrator when my old one went up in smoke. It was so old, guess a wire shorted out. Love my new one even more. The design allows me to use all the trays and sheets as nothing drips down into the motor area. My old one had to reserve the bottom tray and one plastic leather sheet to catch the drips and crumbs. The new one, don't have to do that. Also has a dial for temp setting and, it is a lot quieter and seems a lot quicker to dry foods than the old Nesco.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: LOVED
customer_reviews.text: instant shipping and now a beloved part of the kitchen stuffs . Do spend the little extra for the jerky maker I ended up buying it after the fact . make everything from jerky to dried herbs dog treats without chemicals is one thing eliminating that cost every month has already paid for this unit 3 times over. Our dogs LOVE sweet potato chips beats rawhide from who knows where or the added 40-50 a month for treats. The only down side your friends and relatives will be stealing your jerky or asking you to dry herbs for them!
customer_reviews.author: joseph savino

customer_reviews.title: The machine is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I mostly make treats for my 4 legged kiddos. I started hydrating my own fruit and chicken jerky because the ones at the pet store are overly priced with not much in a bag. With 4 dogs, 1 bag at the store isn't even enough for them to get 2 or 3 treats each. By hydrating my own fruits and meat, its saved me a lot of money and most importantly I know the exact ingredients their eating. The machine is very easy to use, just slice your goodies evenly and set the time as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Pompom

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first time dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: I've only recently gotten into dehydrating to create dry rubs and other BBQ-related spices. As someone who has never used a dehydrator before, this was a perfect buy. It has all the features you'll need if you're going for simple, easy tasks. I might upgrade to a more expensive model in the future, but this one certainly does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert

customer_reviews.title: A great dryer
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, I didn't picture myself using it a lot, but now I use it so much, I'm looking at buying more trays. I love the dried apples I get from this, and every year I always wind up with more fruit than I need. Earlier this year, I had a bunch of strawberries about to go bad, so I cut them up, popped them in, and the results are delicious. The same happened with a bumper crop of asian pears. The dried pears were so delicious and easy to make. It's a great little dryer, and I've used it maybe fifty times so far with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mochi Girl

customer_reviews.title: I love this model
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in a year. Not because the other one broke but because I couldn't keep up with the apricot harvest. I had the oven going too but the oven makes them really dark and took 24 hours per batch. This is faster and takes about 12 hours. I love this model. I had a third one before and the motor was at the bottom. This one is at the top which I live because nothing is dripping onto the motor.
customer_reviews.author: postie

customer_reviews.title: Great Jerky for the Whole Family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son and his family. I bought them another brand years ago and it still works but takes forever. Saw this one on Amazon and got it for him. He said it does the job in less than 1/2 the time of the other one and he loves that the air flow is from the top. Not as messy as his other one either...a hit! They use it a lot and he said clean up is not too bad either. All in all a pretty good purchase. Fast delivery and packaged well. Really a great food dehydrator for the money! Thank you Nesco and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Gail D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dehydrator!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this two days ago and I've already dehydrated bananas, apples, potatoes, and I have some strawberries going right now. So yeah, I was a little excited hahaha. Anyway it works great, comes with 4 trays plus a solid tray for fruit roll-ups or dehydrating liquidy stuff. Also comes with a great guide with recipes, times, and temperatures for dehydrating, plus it includes some jerky seasonings. It's super quiet and works quickly and efficiently. I plan to use it a lot for storing fruits & veggies long-term
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Ray

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! I bought it after seeing a friend who has had the Nesco brand dehydrator for 20 years. Didn't even get to use mine. Was going to make beef jerky. Plugged in the unit and it didn't even work! Strong electrical smell and smoke was coming out from under the top lid.
customer_reviews.author: Phon

customer_reviews.title: Ordered another because I use it so often, I wanted 2 going at once.
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I would want more is to have an off switch. Never has had one, I rectify by using outlet surge with on/off switch. I make fruit and veggie chips, jerky, dry spices, make doggie treats and on and on. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, Not great
customer_reviews.text: This does not include the jerky cure packets as advertised; at least mine didn't. This wasn't a huge deal for me, but it IS false advertising, so that's worth noting. Overall, It works alright, but my fruit certainly didn't dry evenly from tray to tray. The fruit did not vary from tray to tray. I had to move the trays around to get everything to dry evenly. I'm still getting use to the dehydrator, and have only used it twice, so take my criticism as you will.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This dehydrator is great!
customer_reviews.text: Our old dehydrator finally died after about 20 years of service. I was looking for something to replace it and found this FD-60 Snackmaster on Amazon. It arrived very fast and we have been using it almost non-stop for about a month now drying apples, bananas, strawberries, etc. It works great, it is not loud at all, and it is such a huge step up from the one we had, that I bought another one as a present to somebody. And it is made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: V. P.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: The fan did not operate and the motor burned out. It was replaced and the second one did the same thing. I would never buy anything from this company again. There should also be an explanation of the warning label on the box that says: Warning! Cancer and Reproductive harm. I guess I was lucky that it never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Hassler

customer_reviews.title: The Home Dehydrating Standard
customer_reviews.text: Good dehydrator that has somewhat become the standard for home dehydrating. Simple design and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DMA1965

customer_reviews.title: Utter garbage  - avoid
customer_reviews.text: Arrived already broken. Fan would not work at all when I first plugged it in. The unit then emitted a strong burning plastic smell before ceasing to do anything. Now I have to return this thing and waste even more of my time. Not worth buying any Nesco products if their attention to quality is so poor.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Major cost saver!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have made fruit roll ups and dried kiwi. It takes a bit longer on the fruit roll ups than it states in the instructions, but they are delish. I am doing the Paleo lifestyle, so this purchase keeps me from having to invest in the costly dired fruits with no preservatives and added sugars. It is the price of two bags of my sugar free, addative free dried fruits, so it will be a major savings.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Burns out immediately
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought got hot for 30 seconds and then simply quit working. OK maybe it was simply a defect. It happens. I returned in for another. The second one got hot for 30 seconds and simply quit heating up. Two units failed immediately. I won't purchase another Nesco product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started smoking and quit working 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: It started smoking and quit working 10 seconds after I plugged it in. I called Amazon and they sent me out a replacement. I plugged in the replacement and let it run for a couple minutes. So far so good. Certainly appears that they did zero testing on these things before they sent them out.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t take long for me to dehydrate lemon, great fruits and peppers. I put it on before I went to bed and the next morning I started removing the peels and later on during the day, I removed the rest.
customer_reviews.author: jchristina

customer_reviews.title: Dry apples fast
customer_reviews.text: Had a old dehydrater that was making a spike in electric bill took two days to dehydrate but now less than 4 hours on apples
customer_reviews.author: Therese stick

customer_reviews.title: Great dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Nesco I have purchased. I use it daily to make dried meat for my dogs. I have used many different brands, but Nesco one has worked the best. Dries faster than the average hot air dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I recently went on a cookbook buying binge and ended up with a raw cookbook. Lots of the recipes called for a dehydrator and that's what got me to looking into a dehydrator. I read a lot of the reviews and went with this one based on the overall satisfaction of the reviewers and I have to say, I agree. I've used it a number of times and really have enjoyed experimenting with it as well. Very much like it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Laura Clark

customer_reviews.title: best out there
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3 one we have owned. Why 3 did they not last? Nope we just used them so much we wore them out. I like the fact that the unit heater is on top and not the bottom. The is good so that the drippings do not land on the fan or heater. We tried to save money and go cheap but paid for that. One lesson is never buy any dehydrator that has less then 500 watts.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: We had a Nesco 35 that was about 15 years old. We loved it and used it primarily for making beef jerky. The new Nesco is even better than the old on, quieter and nicer with the temperature selector on the top!
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Love new design - fan on top
customer_reviews.text: My old FD-50 gave out and I had 12 trays. So I got this one. I really like the fan on the top. It didn't sit well on my old trays at first, but after one use, everything fit together well. You still may need to rotate your trays, but I haven't found one where you really didn't need to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Hikerdana

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! I've used it to dry fruit
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! I've used it to dry fruit, veggies, fresh herbs and jerky meat without any problems! I holds a decent sized batch depending on what you are drying and doesn't take up a lot of space on the counter. It makes noise while it's running but nothing that isn't to be expected in my opinion. It arrived quickly and on time. I plan to purchase a few more racks and additional fruit roll trays. Overall, I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Milich

customer_reviews.title: Buy this unit it will make you happy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nesco FD-60 and would buy again. The first thing I dehydrated was bread and butter pickles. Oh my gosh, they were so good. Today I am dehydrating left over spaghetti and meat sauce to eat later. All these things are going through my mind to make, pineapple, apples, bananas, oh so many things to cook. My friends are laughing but enjoying what I am making...lol. I am buying meat to make jerky. Get this machine you will enjoy it. I just bought 2 more trays and 4 fruit roll up trays which I will use for the spaghetti etc. This machine makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Nesco dehydrator with this one so that I could use the old trays I already had. My old one had the fan and heater on the bottom which was a pain to clean. This one dries evenly and is much easier to clean as nothing touches the heater and fan. I just throw the trays and the bottom drip tray into the dishwasher and I'm ready for the next time. I also like that you can adjust the temp depending on what you are dehydrating.
customer_reviews.author: Chump Stain

customer_reviews.title: OK I Guess
customer_reviews.text: The trays pictured are not the ones we received. The ones we received did not have the central molding upward. It is just flat and the tray tilts up. The result is it isn't all that strong but at least they don't tilt down, right? Otherwise the heating/fan unit seems fine and fits fine with the stack with the molding that is shown in the picture- which was with our original nesco. Our original one started burning the food after I dropped it about 2 feet, thump:(
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Good Dehydrator for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for jerky! I haven't tried anything else yet. It is a little noisy so I put it in the garage. Thermostat works great. I do not find cleaning the racks a problem as long as I take care. The struts are plastic (all of the racks etc are plastic) and could break if I wasn't careful. I would like to have a timer but can use an external one. good value.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: I love to dry fruit for snacks for my kids!
customer_reviews.text: This dehydrator works great! My kids love to eat the dried fruit right after I take it off the trays! I have dried apples, pineapple, apricots, bananas, mangos, and strawberries so far. I have it 4 stars instead of 5 because the trays are a little hard to wash. The little nooks and crannies where some of the fruit gets lodged is what is hard to wash. But over all I love it and so does my family!
customer_reviews.author: Mel B

customer_reviews.title: Dog treats
customer_reviews.text: I use it to make jerky for my dog. I replaced my old one after 6 years or so . I just leave meat overnight and it’s ready in the morning .I absolutely love it My dog is happy and it saves me so much money on treats I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Djanna

customer_reviews.title: This thing seems great and is actually a lot bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems great and is actually a lot bigger than I expected. I can add more rings to it if I need to, but I don't see that happening. Already put to use a couple of times and works great. The only thing I wish was a little better is the temp control to be a little more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mc

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love this, so easy to make anything. Jerky turns out great. Love how you can just leave it over night
customer_reviews.author: Ina

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a square dehydrator for beef jerky but decided to stick with old faithful. I have another one that is about 5 years old and still going strong. Love the new drip tray at the bottom. Thats nice. Racks are super difficult to clean even with soaking. I will tell you that this thing is great though. I just wish they made an affordable square one with the same design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Best Purchase of the Year
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Use a slicer to slice the apples into really thin even slices and you get the best apple chips ever. Especially, with Fuji or Gala apples. I have dried apples, bananas, and mangoes and have also made beef jerky. This thing is great. Ih, it is a bit noisy, but the level is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Sweebe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic dehydrator. I make my dogs snacks - dried beef liver. Just steam the liver to desired doneness then dehydrate. This dehydrator is much quieter than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I currently own two of this very one. I make beef jerky or elk jerky a few times a year and having two machines help cut down the time. I bought other brands before, all I ended up with disappointment, but this particular one, can't go wrong with this Nesco FD-60 Snackmaster Express 4-Tray Food.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowhawk

customer_reviews.title: LOVE NESCO
customer_reviews.text: FAST DRYING TIME I DONT OWN ANY DEHYDRATERS EXCEPT NESCO USED THESE FOR YRS
customer_reviews.author: PAT BUTLER

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: great product. I liked it so much I bought one as a gift for my really active brother. Because it is round and not square you will find there is mire usable space for drying your food. It also has additional trays for purchase so you can expand the item to allow more drying at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Kcarlough

customer_reviews.title: Where's the heat?
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed because these unit's randomly do not heat to the required temp. Anyone using these should use with a temp gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than my last one...doesnt heat up the kitchen... Works well...
customer_reviews.author: clv129

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a dehydrator for quite a while. I have only used it once but it was very easy to use. So far I have only made zucchini chips, raisins and garlic powder. The chips and raisins took the time stated in the book but the garlic, supposed to take 6-12 hours is now on day 3! I must be doing something wrong and I know I'll figure it out!
customer_reviews.author: Superbizmom

customer_reviews.title: Love this unit
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. Works great and I like that the heater is on the top, makes it easier to keep it clean. Trays are a little lighter weight than my old ones but that's fine. Easy to work. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter is learning to cook
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is now a teenager and is learning to cook. She can make jerky and chips for the family for their outings and it gives her a real grownup feeling, something teenagers really crave. I can only hope that it lasts through all the usage ..and the food that she creates is much better that regular snacks that they used to buy for their trips ...
customer_reviews.author: Bw. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Can you pronounce &$&@&&@&&@
customer_reviews.text: Look at the label in the store if you cannot pronounce it should you be eating it?
customer_reviews.author: Old sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Wish I had more time (Ha
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Wish I had more time (Ha, no! Patience!) to do this with a 2 year old running around. Works wonderfully for a variety of fruits! Although, either I didn't let the persimmons dry long enough, or they literally just taste that bad. Try powdered sugar sprinkled on top to balance the bitter!
customer_reviews.author: Amber M

customer_reviews.title: Don't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time but does not work. Doesn't in come on.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good dehydrator. I'm new to the dehydrating world, but this model is fail-proof to set up and easy to use. It seems sturdy and holds temperature well. I've dried fruit, veggies, fruit leathers, and onions. Many of the other dehydrators had reviews that complained the onion smell was difficult to get out, no so with the Nesco. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Jellyringlover78

customer_reviews.title: Horrible cheap product
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and it broke immediately. It was very cheap plastic but had hopes it would do the job. Do NOT waste your time and money on this product. So disappointed with NESCO!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie K. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Great Dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: Love this dehydrator! Quiet and efficient. Love that it has an adjustable thermostat makes it perfect for many different types of food. Can't wait to really put it to use next year. Got it a little late this year to use it much on my vegetables. Don't know why I waited so long to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Budding Blogger

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I ran it almost nonstop all last season dehydrating various veggies and herbs from my garden. Works great for other stuff like big batches of beans and mushrooms too. I bought two more, one for my mom and one for my sister in law. They love it too. Get extra trays!
customer_reviews.author: Sprocket

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to make beef jerkey and to dry habanero peppers for spices. So far it's been perfect. Tonight I'm going to attempt to make some "fruit leather" with some applesauce. If you have dehydrating to do, this should suit your needs. 3/24/2019 Edit: Still using the same dehydrator after all these years!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Saved our old trays
customer_reviews.text: Our older dehydrator died. The bottom mounted heater/fan gave out. This new one allowed us to use our old trays for an exact fit (check manufacturers website). The new top mounted unit is a much better design. Hopefully it will last as long or longer than our old one (many years).
customer_reviews.author: FairTax pusher

customer_reviews.title: Packaging concerns
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time expected; however better packaging should be used. The outer box in no way appeared to be a box. It was crushed and beat up. Luckily the product inside was still intact. This is by far the best dehydrator I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle D

customer_reviews.title: Great basic dehydrator!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase to start my adventure of dehydrating foods. I haven't quite figured out the timing of everything, as I don't find it to always be consistent with what the booklet says. Other than that, it works great and is relatively easy to clean. It doesn't have a timer but I bought an adapter that I can set to a certain time and then the dehydrator shuts off and that works great!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I make tons of jerky and dried fruits in my dehydrator. I love it! I haven't had any issues with it and it is perfect for me. I wouldn't want anything bigger, but I may order a few more trays at some point, just because sometimes I want to make more fruit than will fit on the 4 trays it comes with
customer_reviews.author: countrygirl777

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Works great on everything I've tried - tomatoes, peppers, apples, pears. Follow the timing guides and don't be impatient. The instruction book says to package foods as soon as they're done, but you should let them cool completely first, or you'll get condensation in the package and your food won't stay dry. The machine is light-weight and easy to move around, but a bit noisy while running (quieter than my dishwasher though). The white plastic trays do stain from tomatoes and red peppers, but the exterior has stayed white so far, and cleans easily. All in all, I'm very happy with it, and I think it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Gehm

customer_reviews.title: and the fan cover portion smells like heated plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same model few years ago, that still works perfectly. But this new one somewhat is a little noisy when plug in power, and the fan cover portion smells like heated plastic. I'd suggest the manufacture to check whether the plastic parts around fan are suitable material.
customer_reviews.author: CYRUS CHU

customer_reviews.title: this is the one I chose based on the great reviews from many sources
customer_reviews.text: My teenaged son had asked for a dehydrator and after doing a lot of research, this is the one I chose based on the great reviews from many sources. It was a wise decision. So far he's only made jerky and dried fish, and they come out great.
customer_reviews.author: andreao35

customer_reviews.title: Nesco FD-60
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good dehydrator and makes it very easy to make beef jerky. It only takes me approximately 2 hours to make 4 trays of jerky. Fast, easy to use and clean. Highly recommend this Nesco Snackmaster FD-60.
customer_reviews.author: cwp

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: Love the temperature gauge on it--I had an old Nesco model with the fan on bottom: a) eventually juices got inside the fan/motor and it died out (after years, mind you). This new one has the fan on top, plus a temperature gauge--which means it's very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Trenidor

customer_reviews.title: Just made more beef jerky this weekend. The weekend ...
customer_reviews.text: Just made more beef jerky this weekend. The weekend before made dried pineapple candy. This works very, very well. An off/ on switch would be handy instead of plugging it in or unplugging it to turn it on and off is not as handy as it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: It works but I’m not 100% happy
customer_reviews.text: I thought the trays would stack up better, they just have small gaps between each layer
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My old dehydrator bit the dust over the winter and I needed another one. I had been given some staking trays for a snackmaster so when I went looking, that is what I decided to buy. Good choice! The food is dehydrated quickly and quietly and it seems very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: tallfarmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: After 8 years I bought a second one. This new one goes to 160 whereas the old one peaks at 155.
customer_reviews.author: ap15

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I already had one and needed another to finish drying my fruit. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Myra Fox

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This did just what it's supposed to. For the price no bells or whistles just gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS WELL MOST OF THE TIME
customer_reviews.text: It works well most of the time. However, the fuses in the power units blow out quickly and easily. Postage between California and Wisconsin for repair is about $13. In order to avoid blowing out the fuses, you need to: -keep 4 trays minimum between the base and the power unit. -don't plug more than one dehydrator into one electrical outlet. -if you run it more than two hours, keep it at a maximum of 125 degrees Fahrenheit. -do not have a carpet, newspaper, etc., between the base and a hard surface. -when removing the power unit from trays after dehydration, place the unit on four different trays so that it can cool-off.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine S. Platzer

customer_reviews.title: Never turned on.
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box and plugged it in. It just never turned on. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Life

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this to make her own dry treats. She is in love with it! She has made fruit roll ups, beef jerky and dry kelps and it all tastes amazing!! It seems very easy to use as well. She just prepare by laying thin cut pieces down, set the timer and that's it. =)
customer_reviews.author: Shakkira

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Great drier. Works just as well as any I've ever seen. Easy to use and easy to clean. Only complaint is that it doesn't have a timer. But I knew that when I bought it and I didn't want to pay more for that feature.
customer_reviews.author: ajac0586

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great dehydrator, it is my second one. My first one lasted 9 years and used it very often, my husband said I wore it out!
customer_reviews.author: Tina S. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dehydrator! I used it a lot ...for drying fruit, veggies, herbs, nuts and coconut. Great workhorse. Not too loud. I have an open floor plan and my kitchen is close to the living room. We don't really find it distracting when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: reliable!!! very good for veggies and small bulk items. I would not use this for mass production, but for home use and limited storage stuff this product is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Demaree

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing dehydrator. I have owned a few in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing dehydrator. I have owned a few in the past and none can compare to this one. I use mine to make deer jerky, others take around 7-8 hours where I can have a batch done in 4 hours with this. Quality is great and the trays wash fine in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Michael Schmitt

product_meta.title: Nesco Snackmaster Express dehydrator, 13.5 inches X 9.75 inches, White
product_meta.description: The NESCO FD-60 Snackmaster Express Dehydrator has the drying power that generates maximum speed and quality for dehydrating your favorite fruits, vegetables, herbs and jerky. The quiet, powerful Converga-Flow fan forces heated air down the exterior pressurized chamber, then horizontally across each individual tray. The air flow then converges in the center for quick, consistent drying that is four times faster than other dehydrators. This dehydrator comes with four (13 1/2″ diameter) trays and expands up to 12 trays so you can dry large quantities at once, with no tray rotation needed. Additional Add-A-Trays sold separately. The adjustable temperature control (95°F -160°F) gives you the flexibility to achieve the best results when drying different foods that need varying temperature settings. The NESCO FD-60 Snackmaster Express provides an easy and economical way to make delicious jerky, nutritious veggie chips, and all-natural fruit snacks at home.
feature_bullets: 500-watt 4-tray food dehydrator dries in hours instead of days and opaque vita-save exterior helps block harmful light which destroys nutritional content of food being dehydrated
Top-mounted fan; adjustable thermostat from 95 to 155 degrees F
Converga-Flow drying system; flavors don't mix; no need to rotate trays
Includes fruit roll sheet and 2 original-flavor jerky spice and cure packets
Made in the USA of Global and Domestic parts
Note: " If a unit overheats there is a thermal cutout fuse (TCO) in line with the element that will open and render the dehydrator inoperable. This is intentional and is considered a safety feature."

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
